I'll tell you, Jim, this translating Japanese texts is difficult.  I've got=
 four dictionaries here, and I still can't find some of the kanji I need, o=
r even a sensible definition of some gana (!), to do two lines of a tsuba d=
escription.  I'll be crawling back with questions later today, after I fini=
sh bombing out.  

Spahn/Hadamitzky is a big improvement on Nelson, but it =
too is not sufficiently complete.

  From:=

  Yes.



    B=
ut you're supposed to read them both as "tsuba" in our usual context? 



 =
     =E9=90=94 can be also be read tan or shin

      =E9=8D=94 can also be=
 read as gaku.
